item.title: Ticket #1619 (Tab highlight issue ) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Really dumb. but we should probably create page-post.php that does something like: 

$this_is_a_page = true;
include('post.php');

item.title: Ticket #1626 (user_nicename should be unique ) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: we also might consider that having the permalink be based on something that can be changed on a whim isn't really such a good idea. These links are far from "perma." Using a sanitized login would be better.

Please try it out on your 1.6 installs.

item.title: Changeset [2824]: Make sure extra_query_vars is an array instead of an empty string to ...
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Make sure extra_query_vars is an array instead of an empty string to avoid weird bug that can cause all query vars to be stomped in certain envs.

item.title: Ticket #1485 (Don't use trailingslashed IRIs if the user doesn't prefer them) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: We could do the smart slashing in the get_*_permastruct() methods of the WP_Rewrite class. The places where we call get_*_permastruct() would assume the structures are already slashed according to user preference and would not call trailingslashit().

item.title: Ticket #1636 (write screen categories section needs horizontal scroller) created
item.dc:creator: paperlion
item.description:
Long category names -or nested ones that display as indented are difficult to read in the relatively small window alloted for them.

There is a vertical scroll bar, but no horizontal one - this appears to be an oversight.

item.title: Ticket #1538 (Trailing slash on RSS feed URL generates a spurious blank line in XML ...) updated
item.dc:creator: Frobenius
item.description:
Every module has been upgraded to WordPress 1.5.2 and now it no longer matters if there is a trailing slash or not, a blank line is generated (with default theme and all plugins disabled), so the problem has grown worse, not better. I haven't any idea which .htaccess lines are relevant. Here is the .htaccess file generated by WordPress:

<IfModule mod_rewrite.c> RewriteEngine On RewriteBase /wp/ RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} -f [OR] RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} -d RewriteRule .*$ - [S=45] RewriteRule (sulfur_island)/trackback/?$ /wp/index.php?pagename=$1&tb=1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule (sulfur_island)/feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?pagename=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule (sulfur_island)/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?pagename=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule (sulfur_island)/page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /wp/index.php?pagename=$1&paged=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule (sulfur_island)(/[0-9]+)?/?$ /wp/index.php?pagename=$1&page=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule (mof)/trackback/?$ /wp/index.php?pagename=$1&tb=1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule (mof)/feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?pagename=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule (mof)/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?pagename=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule (mof)/page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /wp/index.php?pagename=$1&paged=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule (mof)(/[0-9]+)?/?$ /wp/index.php?pagename=$1&page=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?&feed=$1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule (feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?&feed=$1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /wp/index.php?&paged=$1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule comments/feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?&feed=$1&withcomments=1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule comments/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?&feed=$1&withcomments=1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule comments/page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /wp/index.php?&paged=$1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule search/(.+)/feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?s=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule search/(.+)/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?s=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule search/(.+)/page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /wp/index.php?s=$1&paged=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule search/(.+)/?$ /wp/index.php?s=$1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/category/(.+)/feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?category_name=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/category/(.+)/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?category_name=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/category/(.+)/page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /wp/index.php?category_name=$1&paged=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/category/(.+)/?$ /wp/index.php?category_name=$1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/author/([/]+)/feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?author_name=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/author/([/]+)/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?author_name=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/author/([/]+)/page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /wp/index.php?author_name=$1&paged=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/author/([/]+)/?$ /wp/index.php?author_name=$1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/([0-9]{1,2})/([0-9]{1,2})/feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1&monthnum=$2&day=$3&feed=$4 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/([0-9]{1,2})/([0-9]{1,2})/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1&monthnum=$2&day=$3&feed=$4 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/([0-9]{1,2})/([0-9]{1,2})/page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1&monthnum=$2&day=$3&paged=$4 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/([0-9]{1,2})/([0-9]{1,2})/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1&monthnum=$2&day=$3 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/([0-9]{1,2})/feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1&monthnum=$2&feed=$3 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/([0-9]{1,2})/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1&monthnum=$2&feed=$3 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/([0-9]{1,2})/page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1&monthnum=$2&paged=$3 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/([0-9]{1,2})/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1&monthnum=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1&paged=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/date/([0-9]{4})/?$ /wp/index.php?year=$1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/([0-9]+)/trackback/?$ /wp/index.php?p=$1&tb=1 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/([0-9]+)/feed/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?p=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/([0-9]+)/(feed|rdf|rss|rss2|atom)/?$ /wp/index.php?p=$1&feed=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/([0-9]+)/page/?([0-9]{1,})/?$ /wp/index.php?p=$1&paged=$2 [QSA,L] RewriteRule rsp/([0-9]+)(/[0-9]+)?/?$ /wp/index.php?p=$1&page=$2 [QSA,L]

Permalinks work on the site. I suspect it is something with the .htaccess as well, but I am not an expert by any means. If it isn't anything obvious, please resolve as invalid since it may be ISP or web server specific and nothing to do with WordPress.

post_meta and the like will likely happen eventually. This ticket will just track addition/deletion from the above lists.

item.title: Ticket #1628 (Error when posting - Cannot modify header information) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Milestone changed

I saw someone else report this as well. We need to move pingbacks to shutdown, but still, it would be nice to find out what is causing this.

item.title: Ticket #1627 (Could user_nicename be returned in xmlrpc blogger.getUserInfo ?) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Version, Milestone changed

No objection here, although the patch will be somewhat different for WP 1.6, due to changes in the Author table structure.

item.title: Ticket #1634 (Admin interface should be more friendly and less time consuming [AJAX]) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Great idea!

Does it have no-JS fallback?

It'd be great to be able to go through comments and do stuff like "Set as spam" or "Approve" on the fly.

Also, we could add post_meta on the fly.

item.title: Ticket #1632 (duplicate posts) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Are you double-clicking the "Publish" button?

Maybe we should include JavaScript to disable the button after you submit the form.

item.title: Ticket #1626 (user_nicename should be unique ) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
That would mean that nicknames have to be unique (well, more than unique). You can't have someone with a nickname of "User" and someone with a nickname of "user" or someone with a nickname of "This User" and somone with a nickname of "this-user"

Maybe it should just work that when you update your profile, it won't let you choose an existing sanitized nickname. Place that already have it will have problems, and they'll be able to fix them the next time they edit their profiles.

item.title: Ticket #1635 (Dragging "Write" page items over Categories causes them to "go back") created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
When I drag one of the things on the "Write" screen (say, the "Discussion" section) over the category checkboxes, it causes the section I was dragging to "snap" back to its origin (like I had dropped it).

I'm using Firefox 1.06 on Ubuntu Linux 5.04

item.title: Ticket #1550 (Improve l10n stuff) updated
item.dc:creator: runar
item.description:
Version, Severity changed

Using Ubuntu Hoary, Apache2 I can't get latest Wordpress (1.5.2) to accept the nb_NO.mo file, nor does any other .mo file I've tested work.

I have localized the problem to the load_default_textdomain function in wp-includes/wp-l10n.php as that's the function complaining when replacing the wp-l10n.php with the same file from WP1.2.

No errors, no reportings, no log messages. Plain just doesn't work.
